title: Investment and Financing Policy of Corporations and Households
abstractText:
This research programme analyses the investment and financing policy of corporations and households that operate in an uncertain economic environment. The programme is split into two parts.

The first part focuses on corporations, is primarily theoretical in nature, and consists of three research projects. A first project develops a dynamic model for corporate investment, payout and financing policy when there is a separation of ownership and control. The project also analyzes the effect of financing constraints and economic uncertainty on corporate decisions. A second research project intends to model corporate liquidity and its interaction with investment and financing policy in an uncertain economic environment. A third project analyzes the effect of economic uncertainty and industry competition on corporate investment, financing, outsourcing and vertical merger activity.

The second part focuses on households and is primarily empirical in nature. A first project empirically examines the financing and liquidity policy of households using a dataset of Dutch households that covers the period 1993-2003. A second project intends to analyze the determinants of homeownership in the Netherlands.

The study should provide an answer to the questions how socio-economic factors, household demographics and the degree of urbanization influence homeownership, how housing is being financed and how the availability of different types of financing affects homeownership.
